title: Advanced English Communication Course for Pre-Service Mathematics Teachers: Strengthening Mathematical Concept Explanation and Classroom Interaction

context.prior_knowledge: Requires intermediate-level understanding of mathematical theories (calculus, matrices, statistics) and experience using digital tools (Desmos, GeoGebra)
context.additional_context: A program for pre-service mathematics teachers to strengthen English technical terminology usage and classroom communication skills. Focus areas include accurate English expression of mathematical concepts and classroom interaction scenarios.

learning_goals: Learners can create and present academic presentation materials in English using specialized math terminology and formulas (e.g., calculus, matrices, statistics).

Learners can apply classroom interaction strategies required in English-speaking educational environments with ≥80% accuracy and acquire communication skills necessary for explaining math problem-solving processes.

Learners can produce one+ 5-minute English video content explaining three+ math concepts (e.g., calculus, matrices, statistics) using digital tools like Desmos or GeoGebra, achieve a content effectiveness score of ≥4/5 through peer evaluation, and share it on an online platform.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
